1.title: 2014 Movie Preview & Predictions
1.plot: The 2013 movie season is over and we now look to 2014 and what the new year will bring us in movies. Host Erin Darling is joined by producer Matt Raub, director/producer Brad Cruz & Jovenshire from Smosh Games.

1.title: Star Wars Episode 7: Directors List
1.plot: It's A Wrap is back and today we're talking all about 'Star Wars Episode VII' and which directors may be the perfect choice to helm the upcoming movie and possibly the entire trilogy. Find out which directors our panel of experts, including Terri Schwartz, Steve Benaquist & JC Rubio think should take on this epic franchise.

2.title: Star Wars Episode 7: Casting
2.plot: On today's episode of It's A Wrap we talk about casting for the upcoming 'Star Wars' sequels and the possible return of original cast members Harrison Ford, Mark Hamill and Carrie Fisher as Han Solo, Luke Skywalker and Princess Leia.

3.title: World War Z & Zombie Movies
3.plot: On today's episode of It's A Wrap we talk about the production issues 'World War Z' is still facing and where the zombie genre is heading in the future.

4.title: Video Game Movies
4.plot: On today's episode of It's A Wrap, we discuss why video game movies have failed in the past, how they can overcome these obstacles, and what properties we'd like to see on the big screen in the future.

5.title: Movies Based on Toy Lines
5.plot: The It's A Wrap crew debates the merits of movies based on toys or board games and weighs in on where the trend is going and how long we can expect it to last.

6.title: 4-quels & 4-peats
6.plot: Today on It's A Wrap, we discuss the underlying problem with 4-quels and when it IS appropriate to make a fourth installment to a film series.

7.title: 2012 Award Nominations
7.plot: Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Deano Sutter, Joe Hanson and Terri Schwartz to talk about this year's SAG and Golden Globe Award nominations and discuss which films have the best chance of winning and which will most likely get Oscar nominations.

8.title: Post-Apocalypse Movie Trends
8.plot: Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Deano Sutter, Joe Hanson and Terri Schwartz to talk about the latest post-apocalypse Hollywood trend with movies like Elysium, Oblivion and After Earth.

9.title: Christmas Movie Release Guide
9.plot: Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Brad Cruz, Zach Bourque & Deano Sutter to talk about which movies their excited to see over the Christmas holiday. This year's releases include the family comedy 'Parental Guidance', Quentin Tarantino's gritty western 'Django Unchained', classic musical 'Les Miserables' and Tom Cruise action movie 'Jack Reacher'.

10.title: Star Trek Into Darkness
10.plot: Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Brad Cruz, Zach Bourque & Deano Sutter to talk about the upcoming Star Trek sequel, 'Star Trek Into Darkness'.

11.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
11.plot: Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Brad Cruz, Zach Bourque & Deano Sutter to talk time travel, the return of Bryan Singer, and a whole lot of Wolverine.

12.title: Justice League: The Right Move for DC Films
12.plot: Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Deano Sutter, Joe Hanson and Terri Schwartz to talk about the potential (and potential pitfalls) of DC's Justice League movie.

1.title: 2013 Most Anticipated Movies
1.plot: It's a whole new year and there are lots of movies to look forward to. Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Deano Sutter, Joe Hanson, and Terri Schwartz to discuss which movies they are most looking forward to seeing in 2013.

2.title: 2015: The Greatest Year for Movies Ever?
2.plot: With movies like Avatar 2, The Avengers 2, Justice League and Star Wars Episode VII hitting theaters in 2015, is it primed to become the greatest year for movies ever or is there another year that deserves that title? Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Deano Sutter, Joe Hanson and Terri Schwartz to discuss.

3.title: Fox Marvel Movies
3.plot: Fox owns the rights to Marvel heroes like X-Men and Fantastic Four. What additional characters/franchises could be big on the big screen? Hosts Erin Darling and Matt Jones are joined by movie experts Brad Cruz, Zach Bourque & Deano Sutter to discuss.

4.title: 2013 Oscar Predictions
4.plot: We discuss this year's best Oscar hopefuls and snubs on this episode of It's A Wrap.

5.title: 2013 Razzie Awards Predictions
5.plot: We discuss the worst films of the year & which movies we think will take home Razzie Awards on this installment of It's A Wrap.

6.title: Expanding the Star Wars Universe
6.plot: Expanding the Star Wars Universe is the topic at hand on this episode of It's A Wrap.

7.title: 2013 Most Anticipated Horror Movies
7.plot: Our hosts and guests discuss 2013's most anticipated horror movies.

8.title: Remaking the Classics
8.plot: Panelists join our hosts to discuss Hollywood's plans to remake classic films and if any films are untouchable.

9.title: Star Wars Spin-offs & J.J. Abrams Directing
9.plot: Lots of news has been revealed about the upcoming Star Wars movies, including J.J. Abrams directing and standalone spin-off movies that may or may not include Han Solo, Boba Fett, Yoda or Jabba the Hutt. Our movie experts break it down along with host Erin Darling.

10.title: Marvel Phase 3
10.plot: We know that Marvel's Phase 3 will include Ant-Man, Doctor Strange and most likely The Avengers 3, but what other characters/movies would we like to see? Our panelists break it down along with host Erin Darling.

11.title: Are Action Movies Dead?
11.plot: Movies with action elements are all around us, especially when it comes to superhero movies, but are straight up action movies a thing of the past? With recent flops like The Last Stand and Bullet to the Head, where is the future of action movies headed?

12.title: Are Competing Films Bad for Moviegoers?
12.plot: They say originality is dead in Hollywood and there is no better example of how true that is when studios release similar movies around the same time. Our panel of experts discuss.

14.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past Discussed
14.plot: Bryan Singer has been teasing us a lot of information about next year's 'X-Men: Days of Future Past' and our panel of movie experts try to wade through it all to come up with a consensus on what we can expect.

15.title: Fast and Furious 6 vs. The Hangover Part III
15.plot: May 24th is currently set to see the release of two big sequels - Fast and Furious 6 & The Hangover Part 3. Movie experts discuss.

16.title: Batman Movie Future
16.plot: With Christopher Nolan's The Dark Knight trilogy completed and it being unclear if we'll ever see a Justice League movie happen, what does the future hold for our favorite Caped Crusader on the big screen?

17.title: 2013 MTV Movie Awards Nominations
17.plot: Nominations for the 2013 MTV Movie Awards have been announced and we discuss the nominees, the changes to the award shows, snubs and some early favorites.

18.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 Casting
18.plot: With so many characters being added to the cast of 'The Amazing Spider-Man 2' our panel of movie experts break them all down and discuss how they feel about the choices and if it will help or hurt the movie.

19.title: Hulk Movie Future
19.plot: Rumors that a standalone Hulk movie will be based on Planet Hulk have been shot down by director Joss Whedon, but do we want to see it happen and where should Hulk's movie future be?

20.title: Are Vampire & Zombie Movies Dead?
20.plot: Is pop culture done with the trend of vampire and zombie movies? Our panelists discuss on this episode of It's A Wrap.

21.title: Veronica Mars Kickstarter Success Good for Movies?
21.plot: With the 'Veronica Mars' movie reaching its goal in record time on Kickstarter and the film getting a green light, will this become a trend in Hollywood and is it good or bad for the future of movies?

22.title: Jurassic Park 4
22.plot: The director is set and a new Jurassic Park movie is set to hit theaters next year, but will moviegoers still care about dinosaurs?

23.title: Female Superhero Movies
23.plot: Superhero movies are all the rage, but when it comes to female heroes, they've been relegated to secondary characters. With flops like Catwoman and Elektra fresh in Hollywood executives minds, will we ever see a good superhero movie with a female protagonist and which are the best candidates for solo movies?

24.title: J.J. Abrams Exits Star Wars
24.plot: Breaking news that J.J. Abrams has dropped out of 'Star Wars Episode VII' shocks our panelists, but who's replacing him could just be too impossible to believe.

25.title: Most Anticipated Summer Movies
25.plot: Summer is almost here and that means lots of big blockbusters movies! We discuss which we are most excited for and which we thing may surprise us.

26.title: Deadpool Movie: Can It Happen?
26.plot: The Deadpool movie has a script, a star and a director, but so far no green light. The main reason is the R-rating that would ultimately be attached to it. Though R-ratings work well for dramas, comedies and action movies, studios are hesitant when it comes to slapping an R-rating on comic book movies? Will the long delayed Deadpool movie ever happen? Erin Darling and panel discuss.

27.title: 2015: The Summer of Disney?
27.plot: With movies like The Avengers 2, Star Wars Episode VII & Pirates of the Caribbean 5, will 2015 be the Summer of Disney?

28.title: Are Movies "Based on a True Story" Believable?
28.plot: Are Movies "Based On A True Story" Believable? Erin Darling and panelists discuss on this episode of It's A Wrap.

29.title: Iron Man/Tony Stark Future
29.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

30.title: Man of Steel & DC Movie Future
30.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

31.title: Most Anticipated Sci-Fi Movies
31.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

32.title: Ninja Turtles Movie Updates
32.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

33.title: Star Wars Day Special
33.plot: In honor of Star Wars Day, aka May the 4th Be With You, we're talking all things Star Wars with host Erin Darling and panelists.

34.title: The Avengers 2 Additions
34.plot: What characters should join 'The Avengers 2' and show up in standalone movies beyond? Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

35.title: Hollywood's Next Source for Movie Ideas
35.plot: With only so many novels and comic books to draw from, what will Hollywood looks to next as source for the next big movie trend?

36.title: Movies vs. Source Material
36.plot: Do movies have a responsibility to stay true to their source material or do filmmakers have free rein to do whatever they want with our favorite books, video games, comic books, etc? Host Erin Darling and the panel discuss.

37.title: Movie Marathons
37.plot: Movie marathons in anticipation of new movies is a growing fad. Are they worth it and which movie franchises will we actually happy to sit through? Host Erin Darling and panel discuss.

38.title: Future Movie Going Experience
38.plot: With theaters losing customers to other forms of entertainment, they are developing new technology to help bring people back into theaters. Are things like HFR, 4DX and Second Screen the future of the movie going experience and which ones are we excited about and which are just gimmicks?

39.title: Fast & Furious Franchise
39.plot: The future of the Fast & Furious franchise is discussed.

40.title: Marvel Zombies Movie: Could It Happen?
40.plot: We know that superhero movies are big and zombie movies also continue to draw audiences, but could a superhero zombie movie, specifically one based on Marvel Zombies ever get made? Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

41.title: Best Nostalgia Movies
41.plot: Nostalgia movies are discussed on this episode of It's A Wrap!

42.title: Man of Steel 2 vs. Justice League
42.plot: With 'Man of Steel' being a huge success for Warner Bros and being the first film in a possible shared DC Universe, should the studio focus on a sequel to 'Man of Steel' and standalone movies or continue plans for a possible 'Justice League' movie in 2015?

43.title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 Sequels
43.plot: With news that 'The Amazing Spider-Man' will be getting four movies and Shailene Woodley has been cut as Mary Jane Watson from 'The Amazing Spider-Man 2', we discuss the future of the Spider-Man franchise with host Erin Darling.

44.title: TV Shows Turned Movies
44.plot: Hollywood is always looking for new sources for material to churn out new movies and television is no exception with various degrees of success. Host Erin Darling and guests discuss.

45.title: The Wolverine After Hugh Jackman
45.plot: The future of Wolverine after Hugh Jackman is discussed by Erin Darling and panelists.

46.title: 2013 Comic Con Recap
46.plot: We're talking 2013 San Diego Comic-Con and recapping some of our favorite moments with host Erin Darling and panelists.

47.title: Superman vs. Batman Movie
47.plot: Our panel of movie experts discuss the pros & cons of a 'Superman vs. Batman' movie & give their thoughts on who should play Batman.

48.title: The Avengers: Age of Ultron
48.plot: Joss Whedon revealed that the title of 'The Avengers' sequel will be 'Avengers: Age of Ultron'. Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

49.title: Are Original Summer Movies an Endangered Species?
49.plot: With many of the original movies released this summer being some of the biggest box office flops, are original summer blockbusters a thing of the past? Host Erin Darling and guests discuss.

50.title: Favorite Sci-Fi Movies
50.plot: Our panel of movie experts discuss some of their favorite sci-fi films of all-time.

51.title: DC Cinematic Universe Launched from Small Screen?
51.plot: The DC Cinematic Universe has hits with Superman and Batman, but have been unable to launch any other heroes on the big screen. With the success of 'Arrow' on The CW and plans to launch a new Flash series as well as a Wonder Woman show in development, could a successful DC Universe be launched from the small screen?

52.title: B-List Superheroes That Need Movies
52.plot: With most of the A-List superheroes already having their own movies, which B-List heroes should soar onto the big screen next?

53.title: Best Comedians Turned Villains
53.plot: We love comedians when they turn to the dark side and today we're talking about some of our favorite comics turned villains.

54.title: Best Movie Songs
54.plot: Our panel of movie experts wrap up the best movie songs of all-time.

55.title: Ben Affleck As Batman
55.plot: News of Ben Affleck landing the role of Batman shocked us all, but now that we've had some time to take it all in, what do we think of the decision?

56.title: Most Anticipated Movies of 2015
56.plot: What movie is the most anticipated of 2015? Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

57.title: Avengers 2: Who Will Die
57.plot: Joss Whedon is not afraid to kill off major characters, so who do we thing will get the ax in "The Avengers: Age of Ultron"?

58.title: Next Big Thing: Horror Films
58.plot: Horror films have been dominated by zombies, vampires & found-footage films, but what will be the next big thing in horror films? Host Erin Darling discusses with her panelists.

59.title: Are Star Salaries Out of Control?
59.plot: With recent reports that Bruce Willis was fired off 'The Expendables 3' for wanting a million dollars a day, are star salaries our of control or are studios just being frugal?

60.title: 'Carrie' Special
60.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

61.title: What Happened to 'Superman Lives'
61.plot: It was primed to be the craziest superhero movie ever made, but what happened to "Superman Lives?" Host Erin Darling is joined by Jon Schnepp, director of the upcoming documentary "The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?"

62.title: Movie That Need Sequels
62.plot: Panelists discuss the films they think should get sequels with host Erin Darling.

63.title: Best and Worst of Stephen King
63.plot: Stephen King may be the master of horror when it comes to novels, but he has a spotty record when it comes to his movies on the big screen. Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

64.title: Worst Movie Remakes
64.plot: Remakes are here to stay, but what are some of the worst Hollywood has thrust upon us? Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

65.title: 'X-Men: Days of Future Past' Trailer Reactions
65.plot: Host Erin Darling and panelists gather 'round to share their reactions to the "X-Men: Days of Future Past'" trailer.

66.title: Inhumans Marvel's New X-Men?
66.plot: With the new 'Inhumanity' comic, could Marvel be setting up a way to work around their mutant problem in their cinematic universe? Host Erin Darling and panel break it down.

67.title: Best & Worst Biopics
67.plot: Hollywood never has a shortage of biopics, but what are some of the best and worst ever made? Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

68.title: Best Actors Turned Directors
68.plot: Host Erin Darling and panel discuss the best actors turned directors and which have potential to be the next generation of greats.

69.title: 2014's Most Anticipated Comedies
69.plot: A new year comes new laughs and 2014 promises sequels to some of the biggest comedies ever, but which comedy movies are are most excited to see and which are we happy to pass up? Host Erin Darling and panelists discuss.

70.title: 'The Amazing Spider-Man 2' Trailer Reactions
70.plot: The first trailer for 'The Amazing Spider-Man 2' is here and we're getting reactions from producer Matt Raub, director/producer Brad Cruz, Jovenshire from Smosh Games & host Erin Darling.

71.title: Best Movie Trilogy of All Time
71.plot: What is the best movie trilogy of all-time? Our panel of movie experts decide. Host Erin Darling is joined by producer Matt Raub, director/producer Brad Cruz & Jovenshire from Smosh Games.

72.title: Best Movie Twist Endings We Didn't See Coming
72.plot: There have been some great movie twist ending we didn't see coming and our panel of movie experts discuss some of their favorites. Host Erin Darling is joined by producer Matt Raub, director/producer Brad Cruz & Jovenshire from Smosh Games.

73.title: Best and Worst of 2013
73.plot: Our panel of movie experts share their highs and lows at the movies in 2013. Host Erin Darling is joined by producer Matt Raub, director/producer Brad Cruz & Jovenshire from Smosh Games.
